title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON – On a night that belonged to one man, the final score became a secondary detail. The Washington Bullets defeated the Los Angeles Clippers 102-98, but the true story was a historic, singular explosion of offensive brilliance from Clippers guard Pooh Richardson.

In a performance that defies belief, Richardson poured in a staggering 52 points, a total so immense it threatened to single-handedly rewrite the outcome. Every possession was a potential two points, every Clippers offensive set seemingly designed to feed the hot hand. The Bullets, despite having the home-court advantage, found themselves in a desperate fight against one unstoppable force.

Yet, basketball remains a team game, and Washington’s collective effort ultimately weathered the storm. Rod Strickland orchestrated the offense with a cool 19 points and 9 assists, while the frontcourt of Juwan Howard (20 points, 9 rebounds) and Chris Webber (18 points, 11 rebounds) provided the necessary interior balance and scoring punch to counter Richardson’s one-man show.

The Clippers, leaning entirely on their superstar’s historic night, could not find a consistent secondary option. Richardson’s 52 points will be etched in the record books, a legendary performance in a losing effort. For the Bullets, the victory was a testament to resilience, proving that even the most spectacular individual effort can be overcome by a unified team. But this game, forever, will be remembered simply as the night Pooh Richardson scored 52.
